artefact.overview: You must tell DVLA if you have from diplopia (double vision) - download the correct form to let them know
artefact.body:
You must tell DVLA if you have diplopia (double vision).

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

Fill in form V1 and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘V1 - Confidential medical information’ form (PDF, 235KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

Fill in form V1V and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘V1V - Confidential medical information’ form (PDF, 261KB)
